video.title: Life Stories
video.synopsis: This documentary series ventures into the wild to explore the fascinating habits that enable different animal species to survive and thrive.

episodes.synopsis: Some animals don't provide any care for their offspring, while others, like legionary ants, build complex nurseries to house and protect their young.
episodes.title: Episode 1

episodes.synopsis: Surviving means struggling and fighting, and animals employ vastly different strategies to secure food, territory and mates.
episodes.title: Episode 2

episodes.synopsis: Animals pay attention to personal hygiene -- it helps them protect against illnesses, defend themselves and even establish relationships.
episodes.title: Episode 3

episodes.synopsis: Animals display a wide range of eating habits. Ruminants constantly ingest food, while some snakes can go a whole year between meals.
episodes.title: Episode 4

episodes.synopsis: Animals have different practices when it comes to courtship and mating -- and sometimes reproduction doesn't even involve sex.
episodes.title: Episode 5

episodes.synopsis: Alligator turtles, bombardier beetles and anglerfish are a few of the species that use complex methods of deception to escape predators or hunt prey.
episodes.title: Episode 6

episodes.synopsis: Some species of insects, beavers and birds are master builders, employing incredible construction materials and advanced geometry in their creations.
episodes.title: Episode 7

episodes.synopsis: Friendships form in the wild, but they're usually self-serving, providing access to important resources like food, protection or transportation.
episodes.title: Episode 8

episodes.synopsis: Different species have their own unique methods of communication, exchanging messages about love, danger, territory and food.
episodes.title: Episode 9
